snippet: Spaniard couples are staying in troubled relationships longer as a result of the economic crisis and are paying the emotional price because they cannot afford the price of divorce.
abstract: Sabadell Journal; Spain's protracted economic crisis is interfering with ability of some couples to get divorced, as strained finances make expensive divorce impossible.

byline.contributor:
Silvia Taulés contributed reporting
from Barcelona, Spain.

lead_paragraph: Spaniard couples are staying in troubled relationships longer as a result of the economic crisis and are paying the emotional price because they cannot afford the price of divorce.

headline.main: Hard Times in Spain Force Feuding Couples to Delay Divorce
headline.print_headline: In Spain, for Better or Worse, Too Poor to Break Up
